hint.text: Determine the third side and then the area.

solution.text:
We know :
Perimeter = sum of all sides
Therefore, Third side = perimeter - sum of two sides
i.e., Third side = _{{44*j}}_ - (_{{11*j}}_+_{{20*j}}_) = _{{44*j-(11*j+20*j)}}_
Hence, a = _{{11*j}}_, b = _{{20*j}}_ and c = _{{13*j}}_
Thus, s = \(a+b+c\over 2\) = \(_{{11*j}}_+_{{20*j}}_+_{{13*j}}_\over 2\) = _{{22*j}}_
Now, applying Heron's formula:
i.e., Area of triangle = \(\sqrt{s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}\)
i.e., Area of triangle = \(\sqrt{_{{22*j}}_\times _{{11*j}}_\times _{{2*j}}_\times _{{9*j}}_}\)
i.e., Area of triangle = \(\sqrt{_{{11*2*j*11*j*2*j*9*j}}_}\)
i.e., Area of triangle = _{{11*2*3*j*j}}_

content.text: Find the area of a triangle whose two sides are _{{11*j}}_ and _{{20*j}}_ cm and perimeter is _{{44*j}}_ cm.
